intro: Centrosolenia glabra, commonly known as the smooth centrosolenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Centrosolenia glabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
